snippet: Security forces pulled back after seizing control of a large section of the square, setting off clashes with protesters rallying against the Ukrainian government.
abstract: Ukrainian authorities’ surprise decision to storm Kiev's central square occupied by antigovernment protesters sharply escalates tensions with Western leaders, while an equally abrupt pullout by police after nine-hour siege creates growing sense of unpredictability about Pres Viktor F Yanukovich’s handling of the crisis.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington, Oksana Lyachynska from Kiev, and Richard Berry from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Security forces pulled back after seizing control of a large section of the square, setting off clashes with protesters rallying against the Ukrainian government.

headline.main: Ukraine Forces Retreat, Ceding Square to Protests
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Forces Retreat, Ceding Square to Protests
